author: Asjylyn Loder
title: How These Investors Saw Facebook’s Privacy Scandal Coming
text:
When Facebook Inc.’s share price tumbled last month following reports that a voter-profiling firm had improperly obtained profile information of tens of millions of users, many investors were stunned.
But a handful of funds that pick stocks based on good governance scorecards weren’t at all surprised. They were forewarned by index provider MSCI Inc., whose analysts wrote in a June report that Facebook was “exceptionally vulnerable” to backlash from users and regulators because of its focus on “monetizing personal information.”...
